images.copyright: Blue icebergs near Cuverville Island, Antarctica (© Mike Hill/Getty Images)
images.title: The continent that belongs to all of us
images.caption: Antarctica Day
images.desc: At just over 600 miles from the tip of South America, Cuverville Island is closer to civilization than most of Antarctica. As such, this small isle off the northward-jutting Antarctic Peninsula is a hotspot for tourists to catch some cool scenery (while freezing their butts off, of course). Visitors can also chill on the rocky beach with the locals: a glut of gentoo penguins whose rookery here is the largest along the peninsula.
